dashboard.label: 02 : Transmission Success Rate
dashboard.description: Use Case - Monitoring Supply Chain EDI Transactions | Monitoring EDI Acknowledgments

ul.p: When it comes to KPIs for monitoring the success of acknowledgments, the "EDI Transmission Success Rate" is a key metric. Monitoring fluctuations in this success rate—such as sudden spikes or drops—is crucial for identifying potential issues within supply chain systems. For this critical KPI, deviations can be detected using Splunk’s anomaly detection models or by leveraging Splunk’s ITSI for KPI change monitoring.

Successful transmission and acknowledgment of EDI documents are crucial to maintaining an efficient supply chain. When an EDI document, such as a Purchase Order (EDI 850), is sent, it must be delivered to the intended recipient and acknowledged to confirm receipt. A key part of this process is the functional acknowledgment (EDI 997), which serves as a receipt that confirms whether the document has been successfully received and processed by the trading partner’s system.
Several types of EDI documents are commonly used throughout the supply chain, each serving a specific function :

ul.li: Purchase Orders (EDI 850) : Used to place orders with suppliers.
Order Acknowledgments (EDI 855) : Confirm that the supplier has received the purchase order.
Advance Ship Notices (EDI 856) : Provide details about shipments that are en route.
Invoices (EDI 810) : Outline the billing details for the goods or services provided

ul.p: The percentage of successfully transmitted EDI documents (e.g., 850 Purchase Orders, 856 Advance Shipment Notices, 810 Invoices) compared to the total number of documents sent.

A high transmission success rate ensures that critical supply chain documents are delivered to the correct recipient systems without errors. Monitoring this KPI helps prevent operational delays due to missing or failed transmissions.

This solutions template demonstrates a variety of analytics techniques for building solutions. The analysis showcases foundational approaches for generating critical insights, accelerating development by providing an environment with data available for experimentation.

b.font: Analyze EDI transaction status occurence trends.

ul.p: To calculate the success rate, we first need to count the total number of requests and the number of successful requests, then apply a formula to determine the success rate. This requires aggregating both the total requests and the successful events. By using the "timechart" command, we can generate a statistical trend with the following SPL.

table.title: RESULT ANALYSIS 01 : Trends on EDI response status

search.query: index=supply_chain_edi sourcetype="edi:x12" | table _time edi_ack_status edi_buyer edi_code edi_code_ack edi_cont_num edi_date edi_flag edi_requestor edi_responder edi_seller edi_sequence edi_time edi_tr_id edi_type | eval edi_ack_status_combo=edi_code+"-"+edi_code_ack+"-"+edi_ack_status | eval edi_code_groupby=if(isnull(edi_code_ack), edi_code, edi_code_ack) | stats last(_time) as _time, last(edi_requestor) as edi_requestor, last(edi_responder) as edi_responder, first(edi_code) as edi_type, values(edi_code) as edi_code, last(edi_ack_status) as edi_ack_status by edi_tr_id edi_code_groupby | eval edi_ack_success=if(isnull(edi_ack_status), "No_Respond" , "Respond") | timechart count by edi_ack_success | eval edi_ack_request_total=No_Respond+Respond | sort - _time

chart.title: Trends on EDI response status - Visual Line Chart

search.query: index=supply_chain_edi sourcetype="edi:x12" | table _time edi_ack_status edi_buyer edi_code edi_code_ack edi_cont_num edi_date edi_flag edi_requestor edi_responder edi_seller edi_sequence edi_time edi_tr_id edi_type | eval edi_ack_status_combo=edi_code+"-"+edi_code_ack+"-"+edi_ack_status | eval edi_code_groupby=if(isnull(edi_code_ack), edi_code, edi_code_ack) | stats last(_time) as _time, last(edi_requestor) as edi_requestor, last(edi_responder) as edi_responder, first(edi_code) as edi_type, values(edi_code) as edi_code, last(edi_ack_status) as edi_ack_status by edi_tr_id edi_code_groupby | eval edi_ack_success=if(isnull(edi_ack_status), "No_Respond" , "Respond") | timechart count by edi_ack_success | eval edi_ack_request_total=No_Respond+Respond

b.font: Analyze trends in EDI transmission success rates.

ul.p: Finally, we can calculate the "EDI Transmission Success Rate" by using the "eval" command to apply the appropriate formula. " | eval edi_ack_request_total=No_Respond+Respond | eval edi_ack_success_rate=(Respond/edi_ack_request_total)*100"

table.title: RESULT ANALYSIS 01 : Trends on EDI transmission success rates

search.query: index=supply_chain_edi sourcetype="edi:x12" | table _time edi_ack_status edi_buyer edi_code edi_code_ack edi_cont_num edi_date edi_flag edi_requestor edi_responder edi_seller edi_sequence edi_time edi_tr_id edi_type | eval edi_ack_status_combo=edi_code+"-"+edi_code_ack+"-"+edi_ack_status | eval edi_code_groupby=if(isnull(edi_code_ack), edi_code, edi_code_ack) | stats last(_time) as _time, last(edi_requestor) as edi_requestor, last(edi_responder) as edi_responder, first(edi_code) as edi_type, values(edi_code) as edi_code, last(edi_ack_status) as edi_ack_status by edi_tr_id edi_code_groupby | eval edi_ack_success=if(isnull(edi_ack_status), "No_Respond" , "Respond") | timechart count by edi_ack_success | eval edi_ack_request_total=No_Respond+Respond | eval edi_ack_success_rate=(Respond/edi_ack_request_total)*100 | fields - edi_ack_request_total | sort - _time

chart.title: Trends on EDI transmission success rates w/ occurrences

search.query: index=supply_chain_edi sourcetype="edi:x12" | table _time edi_ack_status edi_buyer edi_code edi_code_ack edi_cont_num edi_date edi_flag edi_requestor edi_responder edi_seller edi_sequence edi_time edi_tr_id edi_type | eval edi_ack_status_combo=edi_code+"-"+edi_code_ack+"-"+edi_ack_status | eval edi_code_groupby=if(isnull(edi_code_ack), edi_code, edi_code_ack) | stats last(_time) as _time, last(edi_requestor) as edi_requestor, last(edi_responder) as edi_responder, first(edi_code) as edi_type, values(edi_code) as edi_code, last(edi_ack_status) as edi_ack_status by edi_tr_id edi_code_groupby | eval edi_ack_success=if(isnull(edi_ack_status), "No_Respond" , "Respond") | timechart count by edi_ack_success | eval edi_ack_request_total=No_Respond+Respond | eval edi_ack_success_rate=(Respond/edi_ack_request_total)*100 | fields - edi_ack_request_total

b.font: Finding the times when the response rate is below SLA. 80%

ul.p: To proactively receive alerts for fluctuations in the success rate, we can either set a fixed threshold for the rate to trigger an alert or use adaptive thresholding to monitor deviations from the normal range. Here's an example of applying a fixed threshold for monitoring.

table.title: RESULT ANALYSIS 01 : Times when response rates were below SLA.

search.query: index=supply_chain_edi sourcetype="edi:x12" | table _time edi_ack_status edi_buyer edi_code edi_code_ack edi_cont_num edi_date edi_flag edi_requestor edi_responder edi_seller edi_sequence edi_time edi_tr_id edi_type | eval edi_ack_status_combo=edi_code+"-"+edi_code_ack+"-"+edi_ack_status | eval edi_code_groupby=if(isnull(edi_code_ack), edi_code, edi_code_ack) | stats last(_time) as _time, last(edi_requestor) as edi_requestor, last(edi_responder) as edi_responder, first(edi_code) as edi_type, values(edi_code) as edi_code, last(edi_ack_status) as edi_ack_status by edi_tr_id edi_code_groupby | eval edi_ack_success=if(isnull(edi_ack_status), "No_Respond" , "Respond") | timechart count by edi_ack_success | eval edi_ack_request_total=No_Respond+Respond | eval edi_ack_success_rate=(Respond/edi_ack_request_total)*100 | fields - edi_ack_request_total | search edi_ack_success_rate<80

chart.title: Trends when response rates were below SLA.

search.query: index=supply_chain_edi sourcetype="edi:x12" | table _time edi_ack_status edi_buyer edi_code edi_code_ack edi_cont_num edi_date edi_flag edi_requestor edi_responder edi_seller edi_sequence edi_time edi_tr_id edi_type | eval edi_ack_status_combo=edi_code+"-"+edi_code_ack+"-"+edi_ack_status | eval edi_code_groupby=if(isnull(edi_code_ack), edi_code, edi_code_ack) | stats last(_time) as _time, last(edi_requestor) as edi_requestor, last(edi_responder) as edi_responder, first(edi_code) as edi_type, values(edi_code) as edi_code, last(edi_ack_status) as edi_ack_status by edi_tr_id edi_code_groupby | eval edi_ack_success=if(isnull(edi_ack_status), "No_Respond" , "Respond") | timechart count by edi_ack_success | eval edi_ack_request_total=No_Respond+Respond | eval edi_ack_success_rate=(Respond/edi_ack_request_total)*100 | search edi_ack_success_rate<80 | table _time, edi_ack_success_rate
